m:properties.d:SessionDescription:
Are you a developer? Want to learn what PowerBI has for you? Then come to my session where you will learn how to enhance your applications with PowerBI experiences...
In this talk I will show you an overview of the developer ecosystem in Power BI and share my experiences in the creation of Power BI Office Apps (Power BI Tiles and Send to PowerBI) and the community PowerShell module PowerBIPS.

Microsoft Azure Search is a new fully managed full-text search service in Microsoft Azure which provides powerful and sophisticated search capabilities to your applications. In this session we will introduce this great new services from the very beginner and create a full search experience in a standard web application and a mobile App.

m:properties.d:SessionName: Azure VM's with SQL Server - Notes from the field
m:properties.d:SessionDescription: Vamos apresentar algumas das boas praticas e a nossa experiencia com máquinas virtuais Azure com SQL Server
m:properties.d:SessionPrerequisites: Conhecimentos basicos SQL e Windows Server

m:properties.d:SessionDescription: Road to database automation addresses the challenges of database inclusion in the Application Lifecycle Management (ALM). The set of processes that enables this inclusion is designated as Database Lifecycle Management. DLM is composed by 3 main parts/phases: database source control, database continuous integration and continuous delivery. This set of processes, where automation is a key factor, enables agile practices that allows to mitigate/manager the gap between applications and databases development. In this presentation, I will discuss the DLM general concepts and present some strategies and tools (source control tools as Mercurial and Git and database migrations management tools as Flyway) that can be used to overcome the first phase: database source control. This phase will unlock the database continuous integration and delivery.

m:properties.d:SessionName: Availability Groups 2016: Quais são as novidades?
m:properties.d:SessionDescription: O SQL Server 2016 está proximo de ser lançado, e muitas novidades estão a caminho. O Availability Groups nao é exceção! Saiba nesta sessão tudo sobre a solucao numero 1 de HADR do SQL Server.

O Query Store é uma nova funcionalidade que será lançada com o SQL Server 2016 que permitirá armazenar o histórico de planos de execução de cada consulta juntamente com os contadores de desempenho. Será possível de uma maneira mais fácil corrigir alguns problemas de desempenho sobre as alterações que ocorrem nos planos de execução. Junta-te a mim nesta sessão, para obter mais informação e falar sobre esta nova funcionalidade, que vai mudar a maneira de podermos corrigir e solucionar problemas de desempenho.

m:properties.d:SessionName: Getting Started with U-SQL & Azure Data Lake Analytics
m:properties.d:SessionDescription:
Born out of the internal Big Data language called SCOPE, U-SQL is the language of the new generation that combines the powers of SQL and the extensibility of the C#. Capable of working with Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Blob Storage, Azure SQL DB & Azure SQL DW and Azure VMs with SQL Server, U-SQL is the language of choice if you are looking for querying and combining data from variety of data sources.
Let us discover what is exactly U-SQL & Azure Data Lake Analytics are and how they can be of big help for your projects.

m:properties.d:SessionName: Introdução ao In-Memory OLTP (hekaton) com SQL Server 2016
m:properties.d:SessionDescription: Quando temos necessidade de efetuar transações à velocidade da luz, esta vai ser sem dúvida a tecnologia que vai pensar usar. Tecnologia nascida na versão anterior (SQL Server 2014) e melhorada na versão 2016, In -Memory OLTP é sem dúvida uma grande aposta por parte da Microsoft para solucionar este tipo de exigências do atual mercado das TI. Nesta sessão vou explicar de uma forma clara o que consiste este novo componente do SGBD da Microsoft como começar a utilizar, limitações e alguns truques para resolver algumas das limitações.
SSISDB catalog · Deployment · Debugging · Azure · Etc.

Find out what Reporting Services may improve even more your Reporting skills. How to pin items to Power BI, new HTML 5 Renderind, PowerPoint Export & Rendering, the custom Parameters Pane, are only some of the new cool stuff that you could find in the new version of Reporting Services. This and a lot more is waiting for you... Come and see for yourself.

Os performance levels de SQL Database são comparáveis entre si através dos DTU (Database Throughput Unit). Nesta sessão vamos analisar resultados de alguns testes de performance no sentido de perceber em números mais conhecidos (MB/s, MB, CPUs, etc) a verdadeira performance de cada nível.

m:properties.d:SessionName: MDX vs DAX: let the battle begin!
m:properties.d:SessionDescription: For many years, MDX was the best (and the only) query language for Microsoft OLAP databases. It's not easy to learn but it's a powerful language for data analysis! With Power Pivot and SSAS Tabular, DAX appeared to meet tabular needs. It's easier to learn and very similar to Excel formulas but can we achieve the same (or better) results than MDX? In this session we will discuss pros and cons of both languages, comparing them by using some real use cases (row-level calculations, time calculations and so on...). It will be a real battle and only one will be the winner!

Com esta sessão ficaremos a conhecer as principais novidades no que diz respeito ao T-SQL na versão CTP mais recente do SQL Server 2016. Temos novidades quer na vertente de desenvolvimento quer de administração.

m:properties.d:SessionName: Desenvolver Visualizações em D3.JS para o PowerBI
m:properties.d:SessionDescription: Não só é tecnicamente possível criar novas visualizações no PowerBI, como o podemos fazer de forma simples e recorrendo ao melhor framework existente o D3.JS Iremos debater o que nos leva a criar visuais á medida, como o fazer e que vantagens isso nos trás a todos https://app.powerbi.com/visuals/

m:properties.d:SessionName: How to use R in SQL Server 2016
m:properties.d:SessionDescription: R represents the primary analysis language for the majority of data scientists and statisticians. SQL Server 2016 will allow you to run R scripts. In this session we will demonstrate how to run R analytics in the database so any user can explore the data, build predictive models and embed the R code into Transact-SQL stored procedures.

m:properties.d:SessionName: Power BI For Real World Business Scenarios
m:properties.d:SessionDescription: Depois de ter partilhado as vantagens e desvantagens do Power View no passado mês de maio de 2015 no SQL Saturdays, desta vez proponho a apresentar dois casos reais na área de jogo e retalho para avaliarem se de facto o Power BI é agora funcional e ultrapassa todas as limitações do Power View. Estará o Power BI preparado para casos reais? Venha descobrir...
Lightning Talks ( "schedule" dedicado em baixo )

Can you hack an SQL Server? In this session you'll see a few examples on how to exploit SQL Server, modify data and take control. Session suited for DBAs and developers (jedi level). Disclaimer: No actual state secrets will be revealed. Please do not send agents to my house again.

m:properties.d:SessionName: Crossjoin Solutions - XViewer for SQL Server DBA
m:properties.d:SessionDescription: Crossjoin Solutions - XViewer for SQL Server DBA

m:properties.d:SessionName: RUMOS - O valor das certificações para o profissional
m:properties.d:SessionDescription: RUMOS - O valor das certificações para o profissional

There are several pretty cool enhancements regarding security in SQL Server 2016.
This session will cover some of them in the following (new) topics:
- Always Encrypted: Worried about having your sensitive data stored in a cloud managed database? This feature can help you, allowing to ensure that your cloud provider can't look at your sensitive data, since it remains encrypted for him, but not for you :-)
- Dynamic Data Masking: By using this feature you can control how does your confidential data appear to those that shouldn't have entire access to it. For instance they should only be able to see the first 3 digits of a phone number...
- Row Level Security: Row-Level Security enables us to control access to rows in a database table based on the characteristics of the user executing a query.
Join me in a set of full demonstrations for all these features!
